 That's probably true, we can't seperate ourselves out of the process.
 
 =
Frank-S


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: vilhellm@...: Tue,=
 18 Sep 2007 20:03:49 +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Question for everyone



=

Even though it may be that researchers are able to record theirthoughts on=
 media, I feel that in many cases it is because theresearcher becomes part =
of the recording mechanism through a form ofpsychokinesis.It includes the t=
he possibility that the researcher is actually incommunication with others =
in the spirit realm and is transferring thethoughts and feeling of those ot=
her beings to the recording device.-Bill--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Fra=
nk Sumption <franks-boxes@...> wrote:>> > I used to get that years ago, and=
 I still get it from the Ol' Lady,where she hears my thoughts. I think impr=
inting our voices andthoughts on recording media (or minds) is childs play =
on our higherlevels of existance. One might hypothesize about my "Princess =
voices",and I wouldn't rule out the possiblity, but "they" claim a seperate=
existence, but, what would you expect?> > Ann, you certainly sound Purple!>=
 > Frank-S> > > To: EVP-ITC@...: lisby@...: Tue, 18 Sep 2007 11:35:14 -0400=
Subject:Re: [EVP-ITC] Question for everyone> > > > > Years ago, when I was =
taping on a reel to reel, mostly, I often gotvoices that sounded maddeningl=
y not like me, but like people I knewwho were not dead. They never identifi=
ed themselves as those people,but the voices were dead ringers (ar ar ar). =
I am also, apparently,able to randomly project my voice into the minds of p=
eople I know. Itbegins to happen to almost everyone that I bond strongly wi=
th. I can'ttell you how many times I have heard someone I know spin around =
andsay, "What?" They always say they hear my voice, but don't understandwha=
t I am saying. This is always accompanied, on my end, by a sort ofringing s=
ound in my head. I cannot control it at all. I'm justthrowing this out ther=
e as food for thought that may pertain to yourdiscussion.....AnnOn Sep 18, =
2007, at 8:13 AM, Zack Widup wrote:>>Very true, Frank! The ghosts who are p=
roducing the EVP's certainly >don't> have brains. :-)>> I have no doubt tha=
t there may be a fewpeople around who could > create EVP> phenomena in an e=
lectrronicdevice, but it would be an extremely small> number. I think most =
ofthe EVP we get are from disembodied beings who> have figured out howto do=
 it.>> Zack>> On Mon, 17 Sep 2007, Frank Sumption wrote:>> >> >It's not bra=
in! We are all spirit, of course we can create our > ownEVPs. You don't sud=
denly become spirit when you die, you just > wakeup. That's why I don't ask=
 questions, I don't want to create > theanswers I'm looking for.> >> > Fran=
k-S> >>> > > > > > > > ____________________________________________________=
______> Capture your memories in an online journal!> http://www.reallivemom=
s.com?ocid=3DTXT_TAGHM&loc=3Dus>

______________________________

activities at the Messenger Caf=E9.
